titleStmt.title: Tvvo elegies consecrated to the neuer-dying memorie of the most worthily admyred; most hartily loued; and generally bewayled prince; Henry Prince of Wales.
titleStmt.author: Brooke, Christopher, d. 1628.
Browne, William, 1590-ca. 1645. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T[homas] S[nodham] for Richard More, and are to be sould at his shoppe in Saint Dunstones Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The first elegy signed: Christopherus Brooke.

"An elegie on the neuer-inough bewailed death of the vvorthy, vertuous, glory of these, and wonder for ensuing times, Henry, Prince of Wales" has separate dated title page; register is continuous. It is signed:"W.B.", i.e. William Browne.
Running title reads: A funerall elegie on the Prince.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shoppe in Saint Dunstones Church-yard
